title: [$250] Enable safe usage of Array.prototype.toSorted across our app

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from this proposal ### Background: Our app already runs on Hermes, which is the default JavaScript engine for React Native on Android and is also used on iOS builds. While Array.prototype.toSorted is a modern ECMAScript method supported in V8 (Chrome) and JavaScriptCore (Safari), it is not yet available in Hermes. Developers want to safely use toSorted in the codebase. Without consistent cross-platform support, adopting this feature introduces risk of crashes and runtime errors in production. ### Problem: When Array.prototype.toSorted is called in Hermes, it throws an error because the method is not implemented, which prevents us from safely using it in our codebase. ### Solution: We will polyfill Array.prototype.toSorted to enable consistent usage across platforms. Implementation steps: 1. Add the array.prototype.tosorted dependency to package.json. 1. Import the package in src/setup/index.ts and invoke its shim() function to define the polyfill globally. 1. Create a new file src/types/array.prototype.tosorted.d.ts to provide TypeScript type declarations for the functions exported by the package. 1. Validate that the app runs without errors across all supported platforms. This solution allows us to safely use toSorted across our app, ensuring modern JavaScript features can be used confidently in a cross-platform environment

title: [$250] Refactor provided component to use useSearchSelector hook and remove unused and duplicated code (Task 7)

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
#### Background Across the application, around 15 components serve the same or very similar functionality: search users. These components use the same source of truth, `OptionListContextProvider,` and use `getValidOptions` to properly filter and sort options with contact. #### Problem Although the functionality of these components is almost the same, their implementation is the same or differs slightly. There is a lot of code duplication, which leads to situations where users experience different behaviours across these functionalities. Working on these components (for example, with performance optimizations) is also problematic for developers, as there are many places that should be checked and updated. For example, when we implemented new parameters in `getValidOptions` there is a need to update all of these components #### Solution To improve code quality and developers’ and users' experience, we’ve implemented the `useSearchSelector` hook, which will be a single place of truth for all components that provide user searching. These components serve: 1. options selection 2. options sorting 3. options filtering 4. phone contacts importing Using that hook will make the user experience more consistent across all components. #### Task 7 ``` 💡 This one should be done with extra care as there is more advanced logic inside the component ``` Refactor provided component to use `useSearchSelector` hook and remove unused and duplicated code. Components: 1. `MoneyRequestAttendeeSelector` Important notes: 1. you can use `InviteReportParticipantsPage` as an example of the implementation 2. you should create new const value to use as `context` param: `CONST.SEARCH_SELECTOR.SEARCH_CONTEXT_ATTENDEES` 3. you need to ensure all functionalities are working correctly. Especially: selection, filtering, ordering, and inviting new users 4. After refactoring, we can remove `getAttendees` cc/ @mountiny @sosek108

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
#### Background Across the application, around 15 components serve the same or very similar functionality: search users. These components use the same source of truth, `OptionListContextProvider,` and use `getValidOptions` to properly filter and sort options with contact. #### Problem Although the functionality of these components is almost the same, their implementation is the same or differs slightly. There is a lot of code duplication, which leads to situations where users experience different behaviours across these functionalities. Working on these components (for example, with performance optimizations) is also problematic for developers, as there are many places that should be checked and updated. For example, when we implemented new parameters in `getValidOptions` there is a need to update all of these components #### Solution To improve code quality and developers’ and users' experience, we’ve implemented the `useSearchSelector` hook, which will be a single place of truth for all components that provide user searching. These components serve: 1. options selection 2. options sorting 3. options filtering 4. phone contacts importing Using that hook will make the user experience more consistent across all components. #### Task 6 Refactor listed components to use `useSearchSelector` hook and remove unused and duplicated code. Components: 1. `AddDelegatePage` 2. `TaskAssigneeSelectorModal` Important notes: 1. you can use `InviteReportParticipantsPage` as an example of the implementation 2. you should use `context` param: `CONST.SEARCH_SELECTOR.SEARCH_CONTEXT_GENERAL` 3. you need to ensure all functionalities are working correctly. Especially: selection, filtering, ordering, and inviting new users cc/ @sosek108 @mountiny

#### Background Across the application, around 15 components serve the same or very similar functionality: search users. There is a lot of code duplication, which leads to situations where users experience different behaviours across these functionalities. Working on these components (for example, with performance optimizations) is also problematic for developers, as there are many places that should be checked and updated. For example, when we implemented new parameters in `getValidOptions` there is a need to update all of these components #### Solution To improve code quality and developers’ and users' experience, we’ve implemented the `useSearchSelector` hook, which will be a single place of truth for all components that provide user searching.
